intro: Ophiuros incurvatus, commonly known as the curled sea holly, is a marine flowering plant found in coastal regions. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its unique, spiral-shaped leaves. The plant thrives in sandy or rocky substrates and is often found in intertidal zones. Its flowers are small and typically blue or purple, arranged in dense clusters. Ophiuros incurvatus plays a role in stabilizing coastal soils and provides habitat for various small marine organisms.
